body:
<!-- This is an auto-generated comment: release notes by coderabbit.ai -->

## Summary by CodeRabbit

* **New Features**
  * Added channel management commands: create, configure, and test communication channels (Telegram, Discord, Slack, webhook).
  * Added session management commands: list, view, delete, export, and fork conversation sessions.
  * Introduced agent marketplace with search, filtering, and review capabilities.
  * Added health monitoring and status reporting for agents.
  * Enabled OAuth token support for Google provider authentication.

* **Bug Fixes**
  * Fixed timezone handling in cost tracking (UTC normalization).
  * Removed incomplete E2E test cases and cleaned up test imports.

<sub>‚úèÔ∏è Tip: You can customize this high-level summary in your review settings.</sub>

<!-- end of auto-generated comment: release notes by coderabbit.ai -->

Please [contact Blacksmith Support](https://app.blacksmith.sh/aurevyn-co/support?autoLogin=true) for assistance.

## Walkthrough This pull request introduces a comprehensive agent interoperability system for Pryx, including agent registry and discovery, capability negotiation, trust management, message routing, federation support, health monitoring, marketplace functionality, and social network integration. Additional changes include new CLI commands for channel and session management, updated GitHub Actions workflows, and extensive supporting documentation. ## Changes |Cohort / File(s)|Summary| |---|---| |**CI/Workflow Configurations**
`.github/workflows/ci.yml`, `.github/workflows/test.yml`|Replaced hard-coded runner images (blacksmith-4vcpu-ubuntu-2404) with ubuntu-latest; updated build matrix for consistency across lint, test, security, and coverage jobs.| |**Project Configuration**
`.gitignore`, `.sisyphus/ralph-loop.local.md`, `.temp_refs/openclaw`, `.temp_refs/opencode`, `README.md`|Updated ignore patterns for compiled binaries, modified sisyphus metadata (timestamps and instructions), bumped submodule references, and added trailing content.| |**CLI Channel Management**
`apps/runtime/cmd/pryx-core/channel_cmd.go`, `apps/runtime/cmd/pryx-core/main.go`|New comprehensive CLI module for managing communication channels (add, remove, enable, disable, test, sync) with support for telegram, discord, slack, and webhook types; updated main.go to route channel subcommands and integrate Slack channel support.| |**CLI Session Management**
`apps/runtime/cmd/pryx-core/session_cmd.go`|New CLI module implementing session operations (list, get, delete, export, fork) with JSON output, markdown export, and session copying via SQL INSERT...SELECT.| |**Agent Bus Core Infrastructure**
`apps/runtime/internal/agentbus/registry.go`, `apps/runtime/internal/agentbus/connection.go`, `apps/runtime/internal/agentbus/router.go`, `apps/runtime/internal/agentbus/logger.go`|Foundational agent management: registry with agent CRUD and filtering by protocol/namespace/tag; connection manager with lifecycle and metrics; message router with direct/wildcard/broadcast routing and subscriptions; structured JSON logging with trace/span correlation.| |**Agent Bus Circuit Breaker & Detection**
`apps/runtime/internal/agentbus/circuitbreaker.go`, `apps/runtime/internal/agentbus/detection.go`, `apps/runtime/internal/agentbus/package.go`|Circuit breaker with closed/open/half-open states; auto-detection orchestrator supporting concurrent adapter detection; package manager for agent package lifecycle with filesystem persistence.| |**Agent Bus Service & Tests**
`apps/runtime/internal/agentbus/service.go`, `apps/runtime/internal/agentbus/agentbus_test.go`|Central hub service coordinating all agent bus managers with auto-detection loops and health checks; comprehensive test suite covering registry, connection, routing, detection, and package management.| |**Capability Service**
`apps/runtime/internal/capability/service.go`, `apps/runtime/internal/capability/service_test.go`|Capability advertisement, discovery, compatibility checking, and negotiation workflow with approval/denial paths and expiration handling; full test coverage for negotiation lifecycle.| |**Federation Service**
`apps/runtime/internal/federation/service.go`, `apps/runtime/internal/federation/service_test.go`|Tool-based federation enabling tool registration, visibility control, invocation simulation, and connection management between agents; comprehensive tests for federation workflows.| |**Handoff Service**
`apps/runtime/internal/handoff/service.go`, `apps/runtime/internal/handoff/service_test.go`|Session handoff orchestration with request/accept/transfer/validation/completion phases; context-based state transfer with event publishing.| |**Health Service**
`apps/runtime/internal/health/service.go`, `apps/runtime/internal/health/service_test.go`|Agent health monitoring with component tracking, heartbeat management, alert generation/acknowledgement, and configurable health checks.| |**Trust Service**
`apps/runtime/internal/trust/service.go`, `apps/runtime/internal/trust/service_test.go`|Trust relationship establishment, reputation scoring, federation node discovery, trust propagation, and policy-based access control with concurrent safety.| |**Marketplace Service**
`apps/runtime/internal/marketplace/service.go`, `apps/runtime/internal/marketplace/service_test.go`|Agent listing with publish/suspend workflows, keyword-based search with filtering/sorting/pagination, review system, category management, and install/download tracking.| |**Agent Messaging Service**
`apps/runtime/internal/agentmessaging/service.go`, `apps/runtime/internal/agentmessaging/service_test.go`|Session-based messaging with conversation management, reply tracking, message history, and state transitions (connecting/connected/disconnected).| |**Message Service**
`apps/runtime/internal/message/service.go`|Core inter-agent message exchange with type/priority enums, handler registry, and in-flight message tracking with expiration checks.| |**Universal Adapter System**
`apps/runtime/internal/universal/adapter.go`, `apps/runtime/internal/universal/types.go`, `apps/runtime/internal/universal/detector.go`|Pluggable adapter interface, connection manager with per-connection circuit breakers, metrics aggregation, and auto-detector for port-scanning and filesystem manifest parsing.| |**Protocol Adapters**
`apps/runtime/internal/universal/http.go`, `apps/runtime/internal/universal/network.go`, `apps/runtime/internal/universal/network_test.go`|HTTP/REST adapter for local agents; network adapter for remote registry-based discovery with auth, caching, and manifest fetching; comprehensive tests with HTTP mocking.| |**Message Routing & Registry**
`apps/runtime/internal/universal/router.go`, `apps/runtime/internal/universal/registry.go`|Thread-safe message router with route-based and broadcast patterns; agent registry with protocol-based filtering.| |**Social Network Integration**
`apps/runtime/internal/universal/social/adapter.go`, `apps/runtime/internal/universal/social/hub.go`, `apps/runtime/internal/universal/social/registry.go`, `apps/runtime/internal/universal/social/manifest.go`, `apps/runtime/internal/universal/social/moltbook.go`, `apps/runtime/internal/universal/social/social.go`, `apps/runtime/internal/universal/social/social_test.go`|Pluggable social adapter framework with hub orchestration, dynamic registry, network manifest parsing, Moltbook adapter implementation, and standardized action/target constants.| |**Universal Message Translation**
`apps/runtime/internal/universal/translator.go`|Bidirectional translation between OpenClaw gateway messages and universal internal format with version detection and capability negotiation.| |**Universal Hub & Tests**
`apps/runtime/internal/universal/universal_test.go`|Unified hub orchestrating adapters, managers, and lifecycle with extensive test coverage for all components and state transitions.| |**Config & Cost Service Updates**
`apps/runtime/internal/config/config.go`, `apps/runtime/internal/cost/service.go`, `apps/runtime/internal/cost/service_test.go`, `apps/runtime/internal/cost/tracker.go`|Removed Slack import from config; normalized cost calculations to UTC; updated RecordCost signature to return error; enhanced tracker for in-memory database connections.| |**Store & LLM Factory**
`apps/runtime/internal/store/store.go`, `apps/runtime/internal/llm/factory/factory.go`|Conditional connection pool sizing for in-memory vs. file-backed databases; added OAuth token resolution as primary key lookup path with refresh support.| |**Logging Infrastructure**
`apps/runtime/internal/logging/zap.go`, `apps/runtime/internal/performance/memory.go`, `apps/runtime/internal/performance/memory_test.go`|New zap-based structured logging facade with global defaults and context support; enhanced memory monitoring with thread-safe flag and snapshot interval reads.| |**Registry Service & Handler**
`apps/runtime/internal/registry/registry.go`, `apps/runtime/internal/registry/handler.go`, `apps/runtime/internal/registry/README.md`|Agent registry REST API with CRUD endpoints, discovery filtering, health updates, and comprehensive documentation.| |**E2E Test Cleanup**
`apps/runtime/e2e/cli_test.go`, `apps/runtime/e2e/mesh_coordination_test.go`, `apps/runtime/e2e/tool_execution_test.go`|Removed incomplete GLM model tests; removed unused baseURL variable; added strings package import.| |**Agent Initialization**
`apps/runtime/internal/agent/agent_test.go`|Updated Agent.New signature to accept keychain and catalog parameters instead of provider interface.| |**MCP Test Robustness**
`apps/runtime/internal/mcp/bundled_screen_test.go`|Added conditional skips for screen capture tool absence to prevent test failures in environments without capture support.| |**Build & Dependencies**
`apps/runtime/go.mod`|Upgraded chi to v5.1.0; added discordgo and slack-go/slack as direct dependencies; removed OTLP-related otel modules; added websocket, zap, and adjusted grpc/backoff versioning.| |**TUI Component Refinement**
`apps/tui/src/components/App.tsx`|Minor formatting adjustment in Mesh view conditional rendering.| |**Development Documentation**
`docs/development/CLI_TUI_PARITY_FIX_REPORT.md`, `docs/development/OAUTH_ANALYSIS.md`, `docs/development/TEST_FIXES_FINAL_REPORT.md`, `docs/prd/agent-interoperability.md`|Comprehensive reports on CLI/TUI parity achievement, OAuth integration gap analysis with recommendations, test fix documentation, and detailed PRD for agent interoperability epic.| ## Estimated code review effort üéØ 5 (Critical) | ‚è±Ô∏è ~120+ minutes ## Poem > üê∞ *Hops with glee through agent lands,* > *Channels, sessions, trust commands,* > *Federated tools and markets bright,* > *A social hub of interop delight!* > *Registry, health, and safety rules‚Äî* > *Pryx now speaks with agent tools!* üåü
üö• Pre-merge checks | ‚úÖ 1 | ‚ùå 2
‚ùå Failed checks (1 warning, 1 inconclusive) | Check name | Status | Explanation | Resolution | | :----------------: | :------------- | :------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------ | :------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- | | Docstring Coverage | ‚ö†Ô∏è Warning | Docstring coverage is 41.40% which is insufficient. The required threshold is 80.00%. | Write docstrings for the functions missing them to satisfy the coverage threshold. | | Title check | ‚ùì Inconclusive | The title 'Develop/v1 production ready' is vague and generic. It uses non-descriptive terms without conveying specific information about the primary changes. | Use a more specific and descriptive title that summarizes the main change, such as 'Add agent interoperability system with universal hub, adapters, and services' or 'Implement comprehensive agent federation framework'. |
‚úÖ Passed checks (1 passed) | Check name | Status | Explanation | | :---------------: | :------- | :---------------------------------------------------------- | | Description Check | ‚úÖ Passed | Check skipped - CodeRabbit‚Äôs high-level summary is enabled. |
‚úèÔ∏è Tip: You can configure your own custom pre-merge checks in the settings.
‚ú® Finishing touches - [ ] üìù Generate docstrings
üß™ Generate unit tests (beta) - [ ] Create PR with unit tests - [ ] Post copyable unit tests in a comment - [ ] Commit unit tests in branch `develop/v1-production-ready`
--- Thanks for using [CodeRabbit](https://coderabbit.ai?utm_source=oss&utm_medium=github&utm_campaign=irfndi/pryx&utm_content=5)! It's free for OSS, and your support helps us grow. If you like it, consider giving us a shout-out.
‚ù§Ô∏è Share - [X](https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?text=I%20just%20used%20%40coderabbitai%20for%20my%20code%20review%2C%20and%20it%27s%20fantastic%21%20It%27s%20free%20for%20OSS%20and%20offers%20a%20free%20trial%20for%20the%20proprietary%20code.%20Check%20it%20out%3A&url=https%3A//coderabbit.ai) - [Mastodon](https://mastodon.social/share?text=I%20just%20used%20%40coderabbitai%20for%20my%20code%20review%2C%20and%20it%27s%20fantastic%21%20It%27s%20free%20for%20OSS%20and%20offers%20a%20free%20trial%20for%20the%20proprietary%20code.%20Check%20it%20out%3A%20https%3A%2F%2Fcoderabbit.ai) - [Reddit](https://www.reddit.com/submit?title=Great%20tool%20for%20code%20review%20-%20CodeRabbit&text=I%20just%20used%20CodeRabbit%20for%20my%20code%20review%2C%20and%20it%27s%20fantastic%21%20It%27s%20free%20for%20OSS%20and%20offers%20a%20free%20trial%20for%20proprietary%20code.%20Check%20it%20out%3A%20https%3A//coderabbit.ai) - [LinkedIn](https://www.linkedin.com/sharing/share-offsite/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fcoderabbit.ai&mini=true&title=Great%20tool%20for%20code%20review%20-%20CodeRabbit&summary=I%20just%20used%20CodeRabbit%20for%20my%20code%20review%2C%20and%20it%27s%20fantastic%21%20It%27s%20free%20for%20OSS%20and%20offers%20a%20free%20trial%20for%20proprietary%20code)
Comment `@coderabbitai help` to get the list of available commands and usage tips.

## Code Review Summary **Status:** No Issues Found | **Recommendation:** Merge
Files Reviewed (63 files) **Workflow Changes:** - `.github/workflows/ci.yml` - Switched from self-hosted to GitHub runners - `.github/workflows/test.yml` - Switched from self-hosted to GitHub runners **New CLI Commands:** - `apps/runtime/cmd/pryx-core/channel_cmd.go` - Channel management (580 lines) - `apps/runtime/cmd/pryx-core/session_cmd.go` - Session management (433 lines) **Core Improvements:** - `apps/runtime/cmd/pryx-core/main.go` - Added channel/session command routing - `apps/runtime/internal/llm/factory/factory.go` - OAuth token integration - `apps/runtime/internal/cost/service.go` - Timezone fixes (UTC) - `apps/runtime/internal/config/config.go` - Import cleanup - `apps/runtime/internal/agent/agent_test.go` - Test fixes **New Packages:** - `apps/runtime/internal/agentbus/*` - Agent bus for interoperability - `apps/runtime/internal/universal/*` - Universal adapter for external agents - `apps/runtime/internal/registry/*` - Agent registry service - `apps/runtime/internal/agentmessaging/*` - Agent messaging service **Documentation:** - `docs/development/CLI_TUI_PARITY_FIX_REPORT.md` - `docs/development/OAUTH_ANALYSIS.md` - `docs/development/TEST_FIXES_FINAL_REPORT.md` - `docs/prd/agent-interoperability.md` **Other Changes:** - `.gitignore` - Added binary file to ignore list - `apps/runtime/go.mod` & `go.sum` - Dependency updates - Various test files - Cleanup and fixes
Other Observations Minor observations that don't block the merge: | File | Line | Observation | |------|------|-------------| | `apps/runtime/cmd/pryx-core/session_cmd.go` | 319 | `strings.Title()` is deprecated in Go 1.18+ (still works in Go 1.24 but emits deprecation warnings) | | Repository | - | Binary file `apps/runtime/cmd/pryx-core/pryx-core` (30MB) is tracked in git, but now added to .gitignore to prevent future additions | **Notes:** - The deprecated `strings.Title()` function still works correctly in Go 1.24 and is only a warning, not an error - The binary file being tracked is a repository hygiene issue but doesn't affect functionality - The PR correctly adds the binary to .gitignore to prevent future commits
Highlights **Positive Changes:** - ‚úÖ OAuth integration properly implemented in factory with token refresh - ‚úÖ Timezone fixes in cost service (using UTC for consistency) - ‚úÖ Proper SQL parameterization (no injection vulnerabilities) - ‚úÖ Error handling is consistent throughout new code - ‚úÖ Help system standardized across all commands - ‚úÖ CLI/TUI feature parity achieved - ‚úÖ Tests pass according to documentation - ‚úÖ Well-documented changes with comprehensive reports

reviews.body:
**Actionable comments posted: 10** > [!NOTE] > Due to the large number of review comments, Critical severity comments were prioritized as inline comments. > [!CAUTION] > Some comments are outside the diff and can‚Äôt be posted inline due to platform limitations. > > > >
> ‚ö†Ô∏è Outside diff range comments (5)
> >
> apps/tui/src/components/App.tsx (1)
> > `270-270`: _‚ö†Ô∏è Potential issue_ | _üü° Minor_ > > **Update the views array to include all 10 views for complete keyboard navigation.** > > The `views` array only contains 6 views but the application now supports 10 views (including "cost", "agents", "policies", "mesh"). This creates an inconsistency where: > - Keyboard shortcuts 7, 8, 9, 0 don't work in the main keyboard handler (lines 293-305) > - Tab navigation (lines 286-291) skips the 4 newer views > > Users can still access these views via the command palette or UI clicks, but keyboard navigation is incomplete. > > > >
> ‚å®Ô∏è Proposed fix to include all views > > ```diff > - const views: View[] = ["chat", "sessions", "channels", "skills", "settings", "mcp"]; > + const views: View[] = ["chat", "sessions", "channels", "skills", "settings", "mcp", "cost", "agents", "policies", "mesh"]; > ``` > > You'll also need to update the keyboard handler to support keys 7-9 and 0: > > ```diff > case "4": > case "5": > - case "6": { > + case "6": > + case "7": > + case "8": > + case "9": { > evt.preventDefault(); > const idx = parseInt(evt.name) - 1; > if (idx < views.length) { > setView(views[idx]); > } > break; > } > + case "0": { > + evt.preventDefault(); > + setView(views[9]); // 0 maps to index 9 (mesh) > + break; > + } > ``` > >
> >
>
> apps/runtime/internal/performance/memory.go (2)
> > `232-258`: _‚ö†Ô∏è Potential issue_ | _üü† Major_ > > **Guard against multiple concurrent monitoring goroutines.** > > `StartMonitoring()` can be called multiple times, spawning multiple goroutines that each take independent snapshots. This leads to duplicate snapshots and unnecessary resource consumption. > > Consider adding a guard flag to prevent multiple monitoring goroutines: > > >
> üîí Proposed fix to prevent multiple goroutines > > ```diff > type MemoryProfiler struct { > mu sync.RWMutex > startTime time.Time > components map[string]*ComponentMemory > snapshots []MemorySnapshot > limits MemoryLimit > logger *log.Logger > enabled bool > + monitoring bool > lastSnapshot time.Time > snapshotEvery time.Duration > onWarning func(usage MemorySnapshot, limit MemoryLimit) > onCritical func(usage MemorySnapshot, limit MemoryLimit) > } > ``` > > ```diff > func (mp *MemoryProfiler) StartMonitoring() { > - mp.mu.RLock() > - enabled := mp.enabled > + mp.mu.Lock() > + if !mp.enabled || mp.monitoring { > + mp.mu.Unlock() > + return > + } > + mp.monitoring = true > snapshotEvery := mp.snapshotEvery > - mp.mu.RUnlock() > - > - if !enabled { > - return > - } > + mp.mu.Unlock() > > go func() { > + defer func() { > + mp.mu.Lock() > + mp.monitoring = false > + mp.mu.Unlock() > + }() > + > ticker := time.NewTicker(snapshotEvery) > defer ticker.Stop() > ``` >
> > --- > > `432-438`: _‚ö†Ô∏è Potential issue_ | _üü° Minor_ > > **Replace custom `max` function with built-in.** > > The project targets Go 1.24.0. The custom `max` function is redundant since Go 1.21 introduced built-in `min` and `max` functions. Remove this function and use the built-in `max` instead. > >
>
> apps/runtime/internal/llm/factory/factory.go (1)
> > `131-174`: _‚ö†Ô∏è Potential issue_ | _üü† Major_ > > **Avoid returning expired OAuth token when refresh fails.** > If Line 163 indicates the token is expired and Line 168 refresh fails, Line 173 still returns the stale token, preventing API key/env fallback in `resolveAPIKey`. This can cause 401s even when a valid API key exists. Consider returning `""` on refresh failure (or when refreshed token can‚Äôt be reloaded) so fallback can proceed. > >
> ‚úÖ Suggested fix > > ```diff > needsRefresh, _ := oauth.IsTokenExpired(providerID) > if needsRefresh { > ctx, cancel := context.WithTimeout(context.Background(), 30*time.Second) > defer cancel() > // Try to refresh, but don't block too long or fail hard if it fails > // If refresh fails, we'll try to use the existing token (might still work) or fall back > - if err := oauth.RefreshToken(ctx, providerID); err == nil { > - token, _ = f.keychain.Get("oauth_" + providerID + "_access") > - } > + if err := oauth.RefreshToken(ctx, providerID); err != nil { > + return "" > + } > + if token, err = f.keychain.Get("oauth_" + providerID + "_access"); err != nil || token == "" { > + return "" > + } > } > ``` >
> >
>
> apps/runtime/internal/universal/http.go (1)
> > `247-248`: _‚ö†Ô∏è Potential issue_ | _üü° Minor_ > > **Nil check missing for conn.Adapter in HealthCheck.** > > `HealthCheck` (line 179) and other methods that use `conn` don't verify that `conn` or `conn.Adapter` is non-nil before use. A nil connection would cause a panic. > >
> >
ü§ñ Fix all issues with AI agents ``` In @.temp_refs/opencode: - Line 1: The .git submodule reference to "https://github.com/anomalyco/opencode" at commit d1d7447493e19ff6236b4363b502fc2de59bf67d is unverifiable and the submodule is unused; either remove the submodule entries or verify the commit. To fix, delete the submodule configuration and working directory (remove the entry for the URL from .gitmodules and .git/config and remove the submodule folder and index entry) if it's not needed, or update the submodule to a valid, accessible commit/branch and ensure the repository actually references it where intended; reference the submodule URL "https://github.com/anomalyco/opencode" and commit id d1d7447493e19ff6236b4363b502fc2de59bf67d when making the change so reviewers can verify you removed or corrected the submodule. In `@apps/runtime/cmd/pryx-core/main.go`: - Around line 208-213: The Slack channel is constructed with its token parameters swapped: NewSlackChannel expects (id, botToken, appToken, eventBus), but the call in main.go passes cfg.SlackAppToken then cfg.SlackBotToken; update the NewSlackChannel invocation that creates slackCh to pass cfg.SlackBotToken as the second argument and cfg.SlackAppToken as the third argument (ensure slackCh construction and subsequent chanMgr.Register call remain unchanged). In `@apps/runtime/internal/agentbus/connection.go`: - Around line 241-267: The HealthCheck function is acquiring a read lock but mutating state (conn.ErrorCount, cm.metrics.ErrorsTotal, and conn.AgentInfo.HealthStatus) and calling conn.Adapter without nil-checks; change it to avoid the data race by either (a) acquire cm.mu.RLock(), snapshot the cm.connections map into a new local slice/map of pointers, release the RLock, then iterate the snapshot and perform mutations while holding cm.mu.Lock() only when incrementing shared counters (or perform all mutations under a single cm.mu.Lock() during the per-connection update), and (b) add nil checks for conn and conn.Adapter (and conn.AgentInfo) before calling conn.Adapter.HealthCheck and before writing AgentInfo.HealthStatus; update references in ConnectionManager.HealthCheck, conn.ErrorCount, cm.metrics.ErrorsTotal, conn.Adapter.HealthCheck, and conn.AgentInfo.HealthStatus accordingly. In `@apps/runtime/internal/agentbus/router.go`: - Around line 77-111: Route() currently holds mr.mu.RLock() and then calls mr.notifySubscribers(msg) which also tries to acquire mr.mu.RLock(), causing a deadlock; to fix, remove the locking from notifySubscribers (leave locking responsibility to callers like MessageRouter.Route) and update notifySubscribers to assume the caller already holds the read lock (or document it), ensuring all accesses inside notifySubscribers use mr.* without re-locking; alternatively, if notifySubscribers must manage locking itself, change Route to release the RLock before calling mr.notifySubscribers(msg) and re-acquire if needed ‚Äî reference MessageRouter.Route, mr.mu.RLock/mr.mu.RUnlock, and notifySubscribers when making the change. - Around line 181-188: Broadcast currently holds mr.mu.RLock() and then calls notifySubscribers, which tries to reacquire the same lock and can deadlock; change Broadcast (or notifySubscribers) to mirror the Route() fix by not holding the lock while calling notifySubscribers ‚Äî either release the RLock before invoking mr.notifySubscribers(msg) or refactor notifySubscribers to operate without taking mr.mu (move any needed protected reads into Broadcast while the lock is held, then call notifySubscribers with the copied data). Ensure you reference MessageRouter.Broadcast and notifySubscribers (and follow the same pattern used in Route) when making the change. In `@apps/runtime/internal/agentmessaging/service.go`: - Around line 323-362: The AddMessageToConversation method has a TOCTOU risk because s.mu is unlocked after checking s.conversations[conversationID] and then re-locked later; consolidate into a single critical section: acquire s.mu once at the start of Service.AddMessageToConversation, check existence, append msg to conv.Messages, update conv.UpdatedAt, set s.replyTo[msg.ID], and append the MessageHistoryEntry to s.history while still holding s.mu, then release the lock (use defer for safety); keep calls to s.summarizeMessage outside the lock if it‚Äôs expensive and does not require protected state, otherwise call it inside the single lock to avoid races. In `@apps/runtime/internal/health/service.go`: - Around line 256-303: PerformHealthCheck currently releases s.mu before reading s.components[req.AgentID], causing a data race; to fix, acquire the read lock (s.mu.RLock()) around the access to s.components[req.AgentID], copy the slice (and if components are pointers, copy the pointed values into a new slice of HealthComponent) into a local variable while still holding the lock, then release the lock and continue processing using that local copy; ensure subsequent calls like s.checkAndGenerateAlerts use the local copy (not s.components) so no shared state is accessed without locking. In `@apps/runtime/internal/universal/detector.go`: - Line 259: The code assigns Protocol: pkg.Protocols[0] without checking that pkg.Protocols is non-empty, which can panic; update the code that builds the AgentPackage handling (the block setting Protocol) to first check len(pkg.Protocols) > 0 and use pkg.Protocols[0] only when present, otherwise set a safe default or omit the Protocol value (e.g., empty string or a sentinel like "unknown"); ensure the change references the same AgentPackage/Protocol assignment so the bounds check prevents index-out-of-range panics. In `@apps/runtime/internal/universal/network.go`: - Around line 300-310: Disconnect currently closes a.stopCh unconditionally which panics on repeated calls; protect the close with the adapter mutex and a nil-check (e.g. in NetworkAdapter.Disconnect: lock a.mu, set a.running=false, if a.stopCh != nil { close(a.stopCh); a.stopCh = nil }, unlock) so closing is idempotent, and ensure NetworkAdapter.Connect still creates a.stopCh and sets running=true while holding a.mu. This removes the unsafe unconditional close/recreation pattern and prevents panics on repeated Disconnect calls. In `@apps/runtime/internal/universal/social/registry.go`: - Around line 152-172: To avoid the RWMutex reentrancy deadlock, don't call Registry.List() while holding r.mu.RLock(); instead call r.List() before acquiring the lock and then RLock only for copying r.manifests. Update ToJSON (and its use of r.manifests and r.mu) so it first sets adapters := r.List(), then acquires r.mu.RLock() to iterate and copy entries from r.manifests into the manifests map, then releases the lock and marshals the state. ```
üü† Major comments (38)
apps/runtime/internal/handoff/service.go-279-334 (1)
`279-334`: _‚ö†Ô∏è Potential issue_ | _üü† Major_ **Potential nil pointer dereference and variable shadowing issue.** 1. Line 330 accesses `contexts[0].SizeBytes` without checking if `contexts` is empty, which would cause a panic. 2. Line 292 shadows the `ctx` parameter (context.Context) with the loop variable, which is a code smell.
üêõ Proposed fix ```diff -func (s *Service) StartTransfer(ctx context.Context, requestID string, contexts []*HandoffContext) ([]*HandoffTransfer, error) { +func (s *Service) StartTransfer(ctx context.Context, requestID string, hContexts []*HandoffContext) ([]*HandoffTransfer, error) { s.mu.RLock() req, exists := s.requests[requestID] active, activeExists := s.activeHandoffs[requestID] s.mu.RUnlock() if !exists || !activeExists { return nil, fmt.Errorf("handoff request not found: %s", requestID) } + if len(hContexts) == 0 { + return nil, fmt.Errorf("no contexts provided for transfer") + } + transfers := make([]*HandoffTransfer, 0) - for _, ctx := range contexts { + for _, hCtx := range hContexts { transfer := &HandoffTransfer{ TransferID: uuid.New().String(), RequestID: requestID, Phase: HandoffPhaseTransfer, Progress: 0, BytesTransferred: 0, - TotalBytes: ctx.SizeBytes, + TotalBytes: hCtx.SizeBytes, Status: "in_progress", Timestamp: time.Now().UTC(), } // Simulate transfer progress - transfer.BytesTransferred = ctx.SizeBytes + transfer.BytesTransferred = hCtx.SizeBytes transfer.Progress = 1.0 transfer.Status = "completed" transfers = append(transfers, transfer) // Update active handoff s.mu.Lock() - active.Contexts = append(active.Contexts, ctx) + active.Contexts = append(active.Contexts, hCtx) active.Transfers = append(active.Transfers, transfer) active.LastUpdate = time.Now().UTC() s.mu.Unlock() } ``` Also fix the event publishing to handle multiple contexts: ```diff // Publish event s.bus.Publish(bus.NewEvent("handoff.transfer.started", "", map[string]interface{}{ "request_id": requestID, - "contexts": len(contexts), - "total_bytes": contexts[0].SizeBytes, + "contexts": len(hContexts), + "total_bytes": totalBytes, // compute sum of all context sizes })) ```

apps/runtime/internal/message/service.go-137-151 (1)
`137-151`: _‚ö†Ô∏è Potential issue_ | _üü† Major_ **`FromAgent` is always empty ‚Äî sender identity is lost.** The `FromAgent` field is hardcoded to an empty string. This means message recipients cannot identify the sender, breaking request-response correlation and audit trails. The sender identity should be passed into the `Send` method or set from context/service configuration.
üîß Suggested approach Consider adding a `fromAgent` parameter to `Send` or storing the local agent ID in the `Service`: ```diff // Service manages message exchange between agents type Service struct { mu sync.RWMutex bus *bus.Bus + localAgentID string messages map[string]*Message responses map[string]*Response inFlight map[string]*Message handlers map[MessageType]MessageHandler } ``` Then use it when creating messages: ```diff msg := &Message{ ID: msgID, Type: req.Type, - FromAgent: "", + FromAgent: s.localAgentID, ToAgent: req.ToAgent, ```
apps/runtime/internal/agentmessaging/service.go-120-141 (1)
`120-141`: _‚ö†Ô∏è Potential issue_ | _üü† Major_ **Race condition on session status update.** After releasing the lock at Line 123, the session status is updated at Line 133 without holding the lock. Another goroutine calling `GetSession` or `GetActiveSessions` could observe the session in an inconsistent "connecting" state, or worse, the write at Line 133 could race with reads.
üîß Proposed fix ‚Äî hold lock during status transition ```diff // Store session s.mu.Lock() s.sessions[session.SessionID] = session - s.mu.Unlock() // Publish event s.bus.Publish(bus.NewEvent("agent.session.connecting", "", map[string]interface{}{ "session_id": session.SessionID, "remote_agent_id": agentID, "endpoint": endpoint, })) // Simulate connection (in real implementation, would establish actual connection) session.Status = SessionStatusConnected session.LastActivity = time.Now().UTC() + s.mu.Unlock() s.bus.Publish(bus.NewEvent("agent.session.connected", "", map[string]interface{}{ ``` Alternatively, if the bus publish should be outside the lock, consider not storing the session until connection is established.
apps/runtime/internal/agentmessaging/service.go-395-411 (1)

apps/runtime/internal/logging/zap.go-120-123 (1)

üêõ Proposed fix ```diff func (m *MoltbookAdapter) executeRequest(ctx context.Context, endpoint, method string, params map[string]interface{}) (interface{}, error) { m.mu.RLock() token := m.token baseURL := m.baseURL m.mu.RUnlock() + reqURL := baseURL + endpoint + + // Add query params for GET requests + if params != nil && method == "GET" { + query := url.Values{} + for k, v := range params { + query.Set(k, fmt.Sprintf("%v", v)) + } + if len(query) > 0 { + reqURL += "?" + query.Encode() + } + } + var body io.Reader if params != nil && (method == "POST" || method == "PUT") { jsonData, err := json.Marshal(params) if err != nil { return nil, fmt.Errorf("failed to marshal params: %w", err) } body = bytes.NewReader(jsonData) } - url := baseURL + endpoint - req, err := http.NewRequestWithContext(ctx, method, url, body) + req, err := http.NewRequestWithContext(ctx, method, reqURL, body) ```

apps/runtime/internal/universal/detector.go-39-48 (1)
`39-48`: _‚ö†Ô∏è Potential issue_ | _üü† Major_ **Start/Stop methods have race conditions and panic risk.** `Start` and `Stop` modify `running` and `stopCh` without mutex protection: 1. `running` flag is not protected by mutex 2. `Stop` closes `stopCh` without checking if already stopped, risking panic on double-close 3. `stopCh` is never recreated after `Stop`, so a restart would operate on a closed channel
üîí Proposed fix ```diff func (d *Detector) Start(ctx context.Context) { + d.mu.Lock() + defer d.mu.Unlock() + if d.running { + return + } d.running = true + d.stopCh = make(chan struct{}) } func (d *Detector) Stop(ctx context.Context) { + d.mu.Lock() + if !d.running { + d.mu.Unlock() + return + } d.running = false + stopCh := d.stopCh + d.mu.Unlock() - close(d.stopCh) + close(stopCh) } ```
apps/runtime/internal/registry/registry.go-78-108 (1)

Callers must remember to validate externally, which is error-prone.

apps/runtime/internal/universal/http.go-166-176 (1)

This has several issues: 1. If `Disconnect` is called twice concurrently, it will panic on double-close 2. The `running` flag is not checked before closing 3. The mutex doesn't protect `stopCh` operations
üîí Proposed fix for thread-safe disconnect ```diff func (a *HTTPAdapter) Disconnect(ctx context.Context, conn *AgentConnection) error { a.mu.Lock() + if !a.running { + a.mu.Unlock() + return nil + } a.running = false - a.mu.Unlock() - - close(a.stopCh) - a.stopCh = make(chan struct{}) + stopCh := a.stopCh + a.stopCh = make(chan struct{}) + a.mu.Unlock() + + close(stopCh) return nil } ```
apps/runtime/internal/universal/adapter.go-115-124 (1)
`115-124`: _‚ö†Ô∏è Potential issue_ | _üü† Major_ **Start and Stop have race conditions.** `Start` and `Stop` modify `running` and close `stopCh` without mutex protection: 1. Concurrent calls can cause double-close panic 2. No guard against calling `Stop` before `Start` 3. `stopCh` is not recreated after `Stop`
üîí Proposed fix ```diff func (cm *ConnectionManager) Start(ctx context.Context) { + cm.mu.Lock() + defer cm.mu.Unlock() + if cm.running { + return + } cm.running = true } func (cm *ConnectionManager) Stop(ctx context.Context) { + cm.mu.Lock() + if !cm.running { + cm.mu.Unlock() + return + } cm.running = false - close(cm.stopCh) + stopCh := cm.stopCh + cm.stopCh = make(chan struct{}) + cm.mu.Unlock() + close(stopCh) } ```
apps/runtime/internal/agentbus/service.go-299-347 (1)
`299-347`: _‚ö†Ô∏è Potential issue_ | _üü† Major_ **Rollback partial startup failures.** If any manager start fails, `running` remains true and already-started managers are left running. Reset `running` and stop earlier managers on error to avoid a half-started hub.
üõ†Ô∏è Suggested fix ```diff s.mu.Lock() if s.running { s.mu.Unlock() return fmt.Errorf("hub already running") } s.running = true s.mu.Unlock() // Initialize managers if err := s.registry.Start(ctx); err != nil { + s.mu.Lock() + s.running = false + s.mu.Unlock() return fmt.Errorf("failed to start registry: %w", err) } if err := s.connections.Start(ctx); err != nil { + _ = s.registry.Stop(ctx) + s.mu.Lock() + s.running = false + s.mu.Unlock() return fmt.Errorf("failed to start connection manager: %w", err) } if err := s.packages.Start(ctx); err != nil { + _ = s.connections.Stop(ctx) + _ = s.registry.Stop(ctx) + s.mu.Lock() + s.running = false + s.mu.Unlock() return fmt.Errorf("failed to start package manager: %w", err) } ```
apps/runtime/internal/universal/network.go-334-392 (1)
`334-392`: _‚ö†Ô∏è Potential issue_ | _üü† Major_ **Keep cache keys consistent between Install and Uninstall.** `Install` caches by `pkg.Name`, but `Uninstall` deletes by `ref`. If `ref` is a URL, uninstall won‚Äôt remove the cache entry. Use a consistent key or delete both ref and name.
üõ†Ô∏è Suggested fix ```diff // Cache the agent agent := &NetworkAgent{ ... } a.mu.Lock() - a.cache[pkg.Name] = agent + a.cache[ref] = agent + a.cache[pkg.Name] = agent a.mu.Unlock() ``` ```diff func (a *NetworkAdapter) Uninstall(ctx context.Context, ref string) error { a.mu.Lock() defer a.mu.Unlock() - delete(a.cache, ref) + if agent, ok := a.cache[ref]; ok { + delete(a.cache, agent.Identity.ID) + } + delete(a.cache, ref) return nil } ```
apps/runtime/internal/agentbus/service.go-393-423 (1)
`393-423`: _‚ö†Ô∏è Potential issue_ | _üü† Major_ **Protect `s.adapters` from concurrent access in auto-detection.** `DetectAll` receives the adapters map at line 410 without a lock while `RegisterAdapter` can mutate it under `s.mu.Lock()`. Concurrent map read/write can panic. Snapshot under a read lock before calling the detector.
üîí Suggested fix ```diff case <-ticker.C: - agents, err := s.detector.DetectAll(ctx, s.adapters) + s.mu.RLock() + adapters := make(map[string]AgentAdapter, len(s.adapters)) + for k, v := range s.adapters { + adapters[k] = v + } + s.mu.RUnlock() + + agents, err := s.detector.DetectAll(ctx, adapters) ```
apps/runtime/internal/agentbus/service.go-630-664 (1)
`630-664`: _‚ö†Ô∏è Potential issue_ | _üü† Major_ **Apply locking and protocol filtering to UninstallPackage for consistency with adapter access patterns.** The UninstallPackage method currently iterates `s.adapters` without holding the read lock, creating a race condition since RegisterAdapter modifies this map under lock. Additionally, like InstallPackage, it ignores the package's `Protocols` field when selecting an adapter, leaving a semantic gap since packages declare supported protocols that should guide adapter selection.
üõ†Ô∏è Suggested fix ```diff var uninstaller AgentAdapter - for _, adapter := range s.adapters { - if uninstaller == nil || adapter.Priority() > uninstaller.Priority() { - uninstaller = adapter - } - } + s.mu.RLock() + adapters := make(map[string]AgentAdapter, len(s.adapters)) + for k, v := range s.adapters { + adapters[k] = v + } + s.mu.RUnlock() + + protocolAllowed := func(p string) bool { + if len(pkg.Protocols) == 0 { + return true + } + for _, proto := range pkg.Protocols { + if proto == p { + return true + } + } + return false + } + + for _, adapter := range adapters { + if !protocolAllowed(adapter.Protocol()) { + continue + } + if uninstaller == nil || adapter.Priority() > uninstaller.Priority() { + uninstaller = adapter + } + } if uninstaller == nil { - return fmt.Errorf("no uninstaller available") + return fmt.Errorf("no uninstaller available for protocols: %v", pkg.Protocols) } ```
apps/runtime/internal/universal/network.go-177-224 (1)
`177-224`: _‚ö†Ô∏è Potential issue_ | _üü† Major_ **Apply configured headers to all HTTP requests.** Only `Detect` applies `config.Headers`. If headers carry authentication or required metadata, `Connect`, `Send`, `Receive`, `HealthCheck`, `Install`, `FetchManifest`, and `SearchAgents` will fail without them. Centralize header application into a helper method and call it for every HTTP request.
üõ†Ô∏è Suggested fix ```diff +func (a *NetworkAdapter) applyHeaders(req *http.Request) { + for key, value := range a.config.Headers { + req.Header.Set(key, value) + } +} + func (a *NetworkAdapter) Detect(ctx context.Context) ([]DetectedAgent, error) { ... - // Add headers - for key, value := range a.config.Headers { - req.Header.Set(key, value) - } + a.applyHeaders(req) ... } func (a *NetworkAdapter) Connect(ctx context.Context, info AgentInfo, config AgentConfig) (*AgentConnection, error) { ... req, err := http.NewRequestWithContext(ctx, "GET", agentURL+"/health", nil) if err != nil { return nil, fmt.Errorf("failed to create request: %w", err) } + a.applyHeaders(req) ```
apps/runtime/internal/agentbus/service.go-576-628 (1)
`576-628`: _‚ö†Ô∏è Potential issue_ | _üü† Major_ **Address thread safety, protocol filtering, and error handling in adapter selection.** The method accesses `s.adapters` without locking, which races with `RegisterAdapter`. It also ignores `pkg.Protocols` when selecting adapters and fails to handle registry registration errors‚Äîboth demonstrated as issues elsewhere in the codebase. - Snapshot adapters under `RLock` before use - Filter adapters by `pkg.Protocols` to ensure correct adapter selection - Handle and log errors from `s.registry.Register()`
üõ†Ô∏è Suggested fix ```diff // Find appropriate adapter for installation - var installer AgentAdapter - for _, adapter := range s.adapters { - if installer == nil || adapter.Priority() > installer.Priority() { - installer = adapter - } - } + s.mu.RLock() + adapters := make(map[string]AgentAdapter, len(s.adapters)) + for k, v := range s.adapters { + adapters[k] = v + } + s.mu.RUnlock() + + protocolAllowed := func(p string) bool { + if len(pkg.Protocols) == 0 { + return true + } + for _, proto := range pkg.Protocols { + if proto == p { + return true + } + } + return false + } + + var installer AgentAdapter + for _, adapter := range adapters { + if !protocolAllowed(adapter.Protocol()) { + continue + } + if installer == nil || adapter.Priority() > installer.Priority() { + installer = adapter + } + } if installer == nil { - return fmt.Errorf("no installer available") + return fmt.Errorf("no installer available for protocols: %v", pkg.Protocols) } if err := installer.Install(ctx, pkg); err != nil { ... } // Register discovered agent - agents, err := s.detector.DetectProtocol(ctx, installer.Protocol(), s.adapters) + agents, err := s.detector.DetectProtocol(ctx, installer.Protocol(), adapters) if err != nil { ... } for _, agent := range agents { if agent.capabilitiesMatches(pkg.Capabilities) { - s.registry.Register(ctx, &agent) + if _, err := s.registry.Register(ctx, &agent); err != nil { + s.logger.Warn("failed to register agent after install", map[string]interface{}{ + "agent": agent.Identity.Name, + "error": err.Error(), + }) + } } } ```
apps/runtime/internal/agentbus/service.go-349-382 (1)
`349-382`: _‚ö†Ô∏è Potential issue_ | _üü† Major_ **Reinitialize `stopCh` in `Stop` to support safe restarts.** `Stop` closes `stopCh` permanently without resetting it. If `Start` is called again after `Stop`, spawned goroutines will read from the closed channel and exit immediately, breaking the service on restart. A subsequent `Stop` call will then panic when attempting to close an already-closed channel.
Suggested fix ```diff // Signal background services to stop close(s.stopCh) s.wg.Wait() + s.stopCh = make(chan struct{}) ```
apps/runtime/internal/universal/network.go-226-260 (1)
`226-260`: _‚ö†Ô∏è Potential issue_ | _üü† Major_ **Handle different auth types correctly based on `AuthType` field.** The code always uses `"Bearer " + ClientID`, but `ClientID` is not a token. The `AuthType` field in config supports `"oauth2"`, `"api_key"`, and `"claim"`, each requiring different auth header formats. Additionally, `ClientSecret` and `Headers` fields are defined but never used. Update the logic to: - Check `config.AuthType` and apply the appropriate auth mechanism. - For oauth2: use a token exchange or proper credentials (not just ClientID). - For api_key: use the correct header format (e.g., `X-API-Key`). - For claim: implement claim-based auth. - Apply any custom headers from `config.Headers`.
